result.execSummary:
The defendant Bo Huss was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
No possession or consumption of alcohol & no entry into any bars or taverns.
Defendant is to follow through with all current treatment programs.

timeConds.notes: Must be completed within first 6 months of probation

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bo Huss

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bo Huss in court with attorney Nick G Cirilli.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:44 PM. State - resolved - amend count #1 to county ordinance of DC with a fine of $300 plus costs, #2 - DRI, #3 - plead as alleged with joint recommendation of a withheld sentence, place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management and follow thru, comply with treatment plan from current treatment, absolute sobriety, no entry into any bars or taverns, no consumption of alcohol - makes statement that the defendant has already done this but would like him to continue with the treatment plan that he was given, employment/school, 35 hours of community service. Cirilli and Huss agree. Court amends count #1 to county ordinance of DC, pleads NC, finds G, fine of $300.00 plus costs - 60 DTP/CO; court dismisses and reads in count #2. Huss pleads NC to count #3 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Cirilli makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Huss withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year with conditions of: follow thru with all current treatment programs, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, costs - paid thru probation, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 35 hours of community service - to be performed within first 6 months of probation, submit DNA sample with expunction rights, right to appeal, adjourned.
Defendant's Response to State's Demand for Discovery
records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt: Attorney Nick G Cirilli in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:18 AM. Cirilli has filed an auth to appear/act. Cirilli has complaint, waives reading, enters NG pleas to all counts. Court continues bond, accepts pleas, sets for FPT. Court explains FPT process for Forest County. Cirilli understands.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bo Huss in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:10 AM. Huss has copy of complaint. Court reads charges, penalties and right to attorney. Huss understands charges, informs court that he is in treatment and under a 90 day settlement agreement. Court reviews paperwork. Huss would like an attorney. Refers to SPD and court appointed attorney, paperwork provided in court. Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 6, 2016 at 09:15 am.
